meanings.definition: A type of earthworm commonly used as fishing bait.
meanings.sent1: I saw the brandlings wriggling in the dirt.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman used brandlings to catch a big fish.
meanings.sent3: The brandlings had a party in the mud, celebrating their fishing adventures.
meanings.sent4: The brandlings danced in the soil, enticing the fish with their wiggles.
meanings.sent5: The brandlings squirmed eagerly, ready to lure in the fish.

meanings.definition: A small, reddish-brown worm with yellow stripes.
meanings.sent1: Look at the brandlings crawling on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The brandlings in the garden added color to the soil.
meanings.sent3: The brandlings raced each other in the garden, showing off their stripes.
meanings.sent4: The brandlings stood out like tiny rainbows in the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The brandlings wiggled happily, enjoying the sunshine on their backs.

meanings.definition: To brandish or wave something around in a showy manner.
meanings.sent1: He brandlings his sword in the air, pretending to be a knight.
meanings.sent2: The magician brandlings his wand, casting spells on the audience.
meanings.sent3: She brandlings her pen like a conductor, directing the words on paper.
meanings.sent4: The dancer brandlings her ribbon, twirling gracefully on stage.
meanings.sent5: The actor brandlings the prop gun, adding drama to the scene.
